alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Macon; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 7:31AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Bullock, southwestern Macon and east central Montgomery Counties through 800 AM CST... At 731 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pike Road, or 12 miles northeast of Meadville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pike Road, Hardaway, Liverpool, Franklin Field, Cross Keys, Sedgefield, Mitchell, Carters Hill, Cecil and Fort Davis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
